]]> Brenda Salinas Want To Be Wicket Smart? Now There's An App For Cricket's Many Rules A new app from the "Guardians of the Laws and Spirit of Cricket" takes on the challenge of explaining the game and its many "delightful complications," using videos, animations and quizzes. Thu, 12 May 2016 14:53:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/12/477797177/want-to-be-wicket-smart-now-theres-an-app-for-crickets-many-rules?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/12/477797177/want-to-be-wicket-smart-now-theres-an-app-for-crickets-many-rules?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology A new app from the "Guardians of the Laws and Spirit of Cricket" takes on the challenge of explaining the game and its many "delightful complications," using videos, animations and quizzes.

]]> Merrit Kennedy Researchers Offer Jet Lag Advice In Return For Data About Your Sleep Users of an app developed by the University of Michigan to help with jet lag entered information on their time zone and sleep patterns that helped academics with their work. But is the approach valid? Thu, 12 May 2016 12:42:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/05/12/477526340/researchers-offer-jet-lag-advice-in-return-for-data-about-your-sleep?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/05/12/477526340/researchers-offer-jet-lag-advice-in-return-for-data-about-your-sleep?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Users of an app developed by the University of Michigan to help with jet lag entered information on their time zone and sleep patterns that helped academics with their work. But is the approach valid?

]]> Alan Yu DIY Blood Tests? There's A Downside To Ordering Your Own It's legal to order diagnostic blood tests without consulting a doctor in many states. But critics say healthy patients can go down a rabbit hole of invasive assays and unnecessary treatments. Thu, 12 May 2016 11:10:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/05/12/477644945/diy-blood-tests-theres-a-downside-to-ordering-your-own?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2016/05/12/477644945/diy-blood-tests-theres-a-downside-to-ordering-your-own?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology It's legal to order diagnostic blood tests without consulting a doctor in many states. But critics say healthy patients can go down a rabbit hole of invasive assays and unnecessary treatments.

]]> Jon Brooks Google To Ban Payday Loan Ads Google says it will ban all payday loan ads from its site. Consumer advocates say the lending practice hurts the poor and vulnerable. Wed, 11 May 2016 16:27:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/11/477693475/google-to-ban-payday-loan-ads?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/2016/05/11/477693475/google-to-ban-payday-loan-ads?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Google says it will ban all payday loan ads from its site. Consumer advocates say the lending practice hurts the poor and vulnerable.

]]> Laura Sydell Google Announces It Will Stop Allowing Ads For Payday Lenders The search giant prohibits ads for dangerous, counterfeit and offensive items, among other things. Now it will also ban ads for loans due in less than 60 days, or with an APR of 36 percent or more. Wed, 11 May 2016 13:09:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/11/477633475/google-announces-it-will-stop-allowing-ads-for-payday-lenders?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/11/477633475/google-announces-it-will-stop-allowing-ads-for-payday-lenders?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology The search giant prohibits ads for dangerous, counterfeit and offensive items, among other things. Now it will also ban ads for loans due in less than 60 days, or with an APR of 36 percent or more.

]]> Camila Domonoske Elon Musk's Hyperloop Dream Has Its 1st Public Demo Imagine a pod that can travel through a tube between San Francisco and Los Angeles in 30 minutes. Hyperloop One tested a piece of this technology in the Nevada desert on Wednesday. Wed, 11 May 2016 12:52:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/11/477645103/elon-musks-hyperloop-dream-is-about-to-have-its-1st-public-demo?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/11/477645103/elon-musks-hyperloop-dream-is-about-to-have-its-1st-public-demo?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Imagine a pod that can travel through a tube between San Francisco and Los Angeles in 30 minutes. Hyperloop One tested a piece of this technology in the Nevada desert on Wednesday.

]]> Dana Farrington Is Facebook Suppressing Politically Conservative Content? The fallout continues after the tech website Gizmodo published an article on Monday alleging that Facebook wasn't just relying on algorithms to identify trending topics on the social media platform. Tue, 10 May 2016 18:06:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/10/477525204/is-facebook-suppressing-politically-conservative-content?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2016/05/10/477525204/is-facebook-suppressing-politically-conservative-content?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology The fallout continues after the tech website Gizmodo published an article on Monday alleging that Facebook wasn't just relying on algorithms to identify trending topics on the social media platform.

]]> Laura Wagner Facebook Denies Supressing Conservative News Stories A former Facebook employee claims the social networking site censors news from conservative sources in its trending news section, according to a story in Gawker's Gizmodo blog. Tue, 10 May 2016 16:25:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/10/477529283/facebook-denies-supressing-conservative-news-stories?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/2016/05/10/477529283/facebook-denies-supressing-conservative-news-stories?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology A former Facebook employee claims the social networking site censors news from conservative sources in its trending news section, according to a story in Gawker's Gizmodo blog.

]]> David Folkenflik Taco Bell's Snapchat Game Is Strong Among Teens, But Does It Sell Tacos? Fast food chains may succeed in entertaining teenagers on platforms like Twitter or Snapchat, but just because a brand makes teens laugh doesn't mean this elusive demographic will buy its products. Tue, 10 May 2016 15:54:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2016/05/10/477336641/taco-bell-s-snapchat-game-is-strong-among-teens-but-does-it-sell-tacos?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2016/05/10/477336641/taco-bell-s-snapchat-game-is-strong-among-teens-but-does-it-sell-tacos?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Fast food chains may succeed in entertaining teenagers on platforms like Twitter or Snapchat, but just because a brand makes teens laugh doesn't mean this elusive demographic will buy its products.

]]> Billy Cruz Researchers Hope This Invention Could Wave Away Medical Data Hacks As health care increasingly moves from hospitals and doctors' offices to the home, patient medical data become more vulnerable to hackers. Dartmouth College researchers hope their product will help. Tue, 10 May 2016 12:10:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/05/10/476941159/researchers-hope-this-invention-could-wave-away-medical-data-hacks?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/05/10/476941159/researchers-hope-this-invention-could-wave-away-medical-data-hacks?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology As health care increasingly moves from hospitals and doctors' offices to the home, patient medical data become more vulnerable to hackers. Dartmouth College researchers hope their product will help.

]]> Jordan Gass-Pooré Blockchain Looks To Change How To Do Business Online Behind the hype of Bitcoin is a technology that could shift how we do business on the Internet. It's called Blockchain. NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Don Tapscott, co-author of a new book about Blockchain and the global economy. Mon, 09 May 2016 16:28:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/09/477382547/blockchain-looks-to-change-how-to-do-business-online?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/2016/05/09/477382547/blockchain-looks-to-change-how-to-do-business-online?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Behind the hype of Bitcoin is a technology that could shift how we do business on the Internet. It's called Blockchain. NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Don Tapscott, co-author of a new book about Blockchain and the global economy.

]]> Bitcoin Evangelist Touts Digital Currency As New Hope For Wall Street Bitcoin gets a lot of attention because drug dealers sometimes use to buy and sell drugs on the digital underground. But that's not all it is. Turns out Bitcoin is also the great new hope on Wall Street — a tool that is so powerful, it might even be able to keep traders honest. Well, there's a Bitcoin evangelist making that case. Mon, 09 May 2016 16:28:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/2016/05/09/477382540/bitcoin-evangelist-touts-digital-currency-as-new-hope-for-wall-street?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/2016/05/09/477382540/bitcoin-evangelist-touts-digital-currency-as-new-hope-for-wall-street?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Bitcoin gets a lot of attention because drug dealers sometimes use to buy and sell drugs on the digital underground. But that's not all it is. Turns out Bitcoin is also the great new hope on Wall Street — a tool that is so powerful, it might even be able to keep traders honest. Well, there's a Bitcoin evangelist making that case.

]]> Aarti Shahani Study Shows People Still Love Inappropriately Referencing Nazis Online Decades ago, Mike Godwin was bothered by how often digital commenters referenced Hitler. Today, Godwin's Law is still thriving, and there are numbers to show it. Mon, 09 May 2016 14:30:00 -0400 http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/05/09/477057058/study-shows-people-still-love-inappropriately-referencing-nazis-online?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/05/09/477057058/study-shows-people-still-love-inappropriately-referencing-nazis-online?utm_medium=RSS&utm_campaign=technology Decades ago, Mike Godwin was bothered by how often digital commenters referenced Hitler. Today, Godwin's Law is still thriving, and there are numbers to show it.

]]> Naomi LaChance
